data.title: World Amateur Boxing Championships
data.meta_description: United Kingdom Track and Field All-Time Lists - Medallists in World Amateur Boxing Championships.
data.text:
The AIBA (Association International de Boxe Amateur) World Amateur Boxing Championships is a biennial event first held in 1974. The number of weight categories was reduced from 12 to 11 in 2003 with the removal of the Light Middleweight division. A women's championships was first staged in 2001. A list of medallists in the Olympic Games and Commonwealth Games is also available on this site.

Venues - Men: 1974 Havana (CUB), 1978 Belgrade (YUG), 1982 Munich (FRG), 1986 Reno (USA), 1989 Moscow (URS), 1991 Sydney (AUS), 1993 Tampere (FIN), 1995 Berlin (GER), 1997 Budapest (HUN), 1999 Houston (USA), 2001 Belfast (GBR), 2003 Bangkok (THA), 2005 Mianyang (CHN)

Venues - Women: 2001 Scranton (USA), 2002 Antalya (TUR), 2005 Podolsk (RUS)
